FuncDef:
The hardware-based enable command enables the hardware forwarding engine on the interface board to send packets and add timestamps to the packets during an ICMP jitter test.
The undo hardware-based command disables the hardware forwarding engine on the interface board from sending packets or adding timestamps to the packets during an ICMP jitter test.
By default, the hardware forwarding engine on an interface board is disabled from sending packets or adding timestamps to the packets.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When ICMP Jitter test are performed, the hardware forwarding engine on the interface board needs to be enabled to send packets and timestamp. In this case, you need to configure the hardware-based enable.
Configuration Impact
After the hardware-based enable command is run, the sendpacket passroute command can be configured but does not take effect.
